TopicTitle: For lack of a better name, the U.F.O.

Articles.Content:
While messing around with the SPH in a new sandbox save, I noticed the flying-saucer shape of the Cupola module, and knew what I had to do.

I present, the U.F.O.

>Download<

It has 3 T-100's of fuel to carry and uses two 48-7S's as propulsion. It carries two pilots and has a rear docking port as the root part, which allows for it to be made into a subassembly.

Be sure to activate SAS while flying, as the center of thrust is slightly offset from the center of mass.

Thanks for your time/views/downloads.
How is that flying? Jet engine clipped in?
Wow, cool! I've never seen any craft like this. What does keep it floating, by the way?
I actually used Hack Gravity for the screenshots, as it would be mostly designed for space travel.

I actually used Hack Gravity for the screenshots, as it would be mostly designed for space travel.

Ah ok. You know you could probably clip a jet engine in that and make it into a VTOL.
